ABOUT ME

BIO

I am Marc, a 24-year-old PhD Student currently working in the ERL VIBOT CNRS team. Passionate about computer vision and artificial intelligence, I am fortunate to be funded by the French National Research Agency to carry out my PhD. I am currently working on the exploitation of unconventional modality (polarimetry) in the field of robotics and intelligent vehicles. For the rest, everything is written below...

My Career & Education

  • October 1, 2018

    PhD - Road scene analysis with a multimodal stereovision system

    ERL VIBOT CNRS 6000 - ImViA - UBFC
    Funding: French National Research Agency through ANR ICUB (ANR-17-CE22-0011)

  • 2018

  • September 12, 2016

    MsCV - Master of Science, Computer Vision

    University of Burgundy - Condorcet - France
    Studying mathematics, programming, robotics, vision, image & signal analysis and the basics of medical imaging, this master allows to have an overview of the research by combining advanced theory and continuous control on advanced projects (explanation of scientific papers, development of basic algorithms , personal projects ...)

  • 2016

  • September 5, 2015

    BsCV - Bachelor of Science, Computer Vision

    University of Burgundy - Condorcet - France
    This bachelor is the springboard to the MsCV. Summarizing the principal concepts and deepening in the areas that the master offers to study, this bachelor is a real advantage in term of theory preparation.

  • 2015

  • September 3, 2013

    DUT GEII - Technical Degree Electronic Engineering and Industrial Computer Science

    University of Burgundy - IUT Le Creusot - France
    GEII is a program created to train future senior technicians in the field of electronics and industrial computing. The basics of electronics, electrical engineering and automation are reviewed while learning programming on computer or electronic card.

Marc Blanchon - 2019
